subject: Investing
title: Overconfidence and Overtrading
description: Learn Overconfidence and Overtrading in one minute.

hook.text: A study found that the most active traders earned 6.5% less per year than the least active ones.

buildup.text: Overconfidence leads investors to trade too often, believing they can time the market consistently.

discovery.text: Each trade incurs costs: commissions, spreads, taxes, and the risk of being wrong.

twist.text: Men trade 45% more often than women and earn about 1% less annually, according to research.

climax.text: The best-performing accounts are often those whose owners forgot they had themâ€”zero trades, zero damage.

punchline.text: The less you trade, the more you tend to keep.

quiz.question: What effect does overtrading typically have on returns?
options: Decreases returns due to costs and errors
